Issues.Title: Performance issue occurs loading data in DataGrid and application go to not responding state
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: Net 6.0
* Windows version: Windows 10 Pro 21H1
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio? No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**  Performance issue occurs when loading 800 records at runtime in DataGrid and application go to not responding state.
 
 **Actual behavior:**  Data loading is delayed and the application go to not responding the state
 
 **Expected behavior:** Data should be loaded properly without the loading delay and the application not responding to the issue
 
 **Minimal repro:** 
 Step 1: Run the Application
 
 Step 2: Open the Task Manager to ensure the application not responding state
 
 Step 3: Click the Load Data button
 
 Please find the sample and video demo for your reference
 
[Sample And Video Demo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9677865/Sample.And.Video.Demo.zip)
 
 Please check this and share the solution to resolve the reported performance issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Performance issue occurs loading data in DataGrid and application go to not responding state" (#7138)

Issues.Title: Tooltips not closing for custom render controls
Issues.Body:
Issue is seen with .NET6.0, including latest 6.0.401
Issue was not present in .NET framework 4.8
Seen on both Windows 10 and 11.

The attached project demonstrates the issue:
If a custom render control does not draw portions of the area that the control covers, then the tooltip should close when the mouse moves off of the drawn parts, as it did in .NET4.8. 
What is observed is that the tooltip stays open as long as the mouse is over the control, including the non-drawn area.

Demonstration: .NET 6.0
![dotnet6 0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/114644709/192958631-09d5c75d-a715-4b73-9c1f-d3010914b9bd.gif)

Demonstration: .NET 4.8
![dotnet4 8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/114644709/192959314-1d4552f6-7874-4a28-b74c-7445287f2120.gif)

[WpfApp3.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9671786/WpfApp3.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tooltips not closing for custom render controls" (#7134)

Issues.Title: My WPF project has a namespace error
Issues.Body:
Error Tip:
No type or namespace name "Windows" in namespace "test.wpf.system" (missing assembly reference?)

This error occurs when my project contains the System namespace.
I predict this is due to the implicit namespaces of.net6.
I tried `<DisableImplicitNamespaceImports>true</DisableImplicitNamespaceImports>` and `<Using Remove="XXX.System" />`  but it didn't work.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22017199/191935560-2c0b601d-507b-481b-921a-fd2807f9cca7.png)

Repeat steps：
build project

Error Code：
https://github.com/344089386/WpfTest
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "My WPF project has a namespace error" (#7125)

Issues.Title: Fix #122 - NullReferenceException in ItemAutomationPeer.GetNameCore()
Issues.Body:
For virtualized tree views it can happen that we are calling GetNameCore() on an item that has been scrolled out of view and doesn't have an associated container. ItemContainerGenerator.GetContainerFromItem() returns null, and so ItemsControlAutomationPeer ends up being null as well.

We're still going to retrieve the name from the item.ToString(), so it's much better than crashing here and aborting the entire layout pass.

Fixes #122

## Customer Impact

Most customers using virtualized tree views with large number of items will hit this, and the impact may be severe (corrupted scrolling, rendering, layout)

## Regression

This is not a regression

## Testing

Testing needs to happen after producing a build with the fix. To test: open a virtualized tree view with lots of items and scroll under debugger. There should be no exceptions.

## Risk

Risk is very low. It's just a null check.
